results.title: Eventful Britain [b&w]
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Travel and Holidays Association
results.brief_description: Sets out to show that there is always something on in Britain. Ranges over a calendar of events, crowded with ceremonies and sporting fixtures which are open to all and cost little or nothing to attend. Includes such events as the Brighton Veteran Car Run, the Farnborough Air Show, the Henley Royal Regatta, the FA Cup Final at Wembley and much more.

results.title: Event horse
results.creator_credit: Robin Crane Films and Robin Crane
results.brief_description: Based on Sheila Willcox’s book “The Event horse”. Tells the story of the training of a “green” horse up to the winning of a novice horse trial. Training technicalities are presented in an interesting way, and the whole story of training and competing is designed to give people a better understanding of the purpose and requirements of a horse trial.

results.title: Evening Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the obligation of each hospital corpsman is to be cheerful and to make each patient comfortable. Demonstrates the alcohol rub which will prevent pressure sores.

results.title: Evaluation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James M. Smith and Davidson Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Specific learning disabilities”.
Follows two children with learning disabilities through a series of auditory, visual and motor tasks to determine their learning strengths and weaknesses. Interprets evaluation results and identifies optimal patterns for learning; relates parents perception of their children’s problems, presents relevant neurological and psychiatric information.

results.title: Evaluating your discussion
results.creator_credit: Educational Research and Development and Teachers Education Program and Far West Laboratory
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Discussing Controversial Issues”.
Designed to help high school students with evaluating and discussing controversial issues. The topics in this film are: George Orwell’s “1984”; Students Appeal Board; and Police reactions - role reversal.

results.brief_description: A German cinemagazine with English commentary. Items include: 1. An industrial designer - Eri Slani. 2. Effects of sedentary jobs. 3. Elizabeth Begaria, Foreign Affairs Minister. 4. Latest shoe fashion.

results.title: European wasp
results.creator_credit: Greg Taylor Productions and Museum Victoria
results.brief_description: A well made slide-tape program transferred to video which looks at the European wasp in Australia. Addresses the introduction of the wasps in Australia, the life pattern, nesting habitat, danger of the bite, first aid treatment and eradication methods.
